intro: Sunania neofiliformis, commonly known as the Filiform Sunania, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
